intro: Romanoa tamnoides var. sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Romanoa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which have a distinctive sinuous or wavy edge. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
